course_title: Special Topics: Ecology and its Applications
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Pre-requisite: ENVS 131 or permission of the instructor
This course fulfills the Intermediate Breadth in Ecology/Environmental Health for ENVS majors. For ENVSMIN, may be used to fulfill the Ecology and Conservation Breadth area. For students in the Sustainability Science (SUSTSCI) minors, may be used to fulfill Natural Science course.
course_description: A course designed for second year students on topics of interest in environmental sciences. This course may count as elective credit for the ENVS major and minor; relevant topics may count towards the ENVS Sustainability Sciences or Earth and Atmospheric Sciences minors. See current course atlas.
schedule_location: TTh 8:30am-9:45am in Math & Science Center - W502
sections: Class Nbr: 2670, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 8:30-9:45a, Instructor: E. Lonsdorf, Status: Wait List
